head.supplied: Chief Secretary's Office, ¶ Melbourne, 1st July 1885. ¶ Memorandum. ¶ ¶ In view of supply on account of the current financial year being asked for at any early date, the Government Botanist is reques...

div.p: No. 2503, pp. 665-6, unit 70, VPRS 1187/P, outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office of Victoria.

Document is a circular (p. 665) to the heads of 14 departments (listed p. 666) within the Chief Secretary's Department, with the name of each department filled in as appropriate. The memorandum is unsigned. Wilson is identified as correspondent since he was Under-Secretary in the Chief Secretary's Department at the time. Chief Secretary's Office,

In view of supply on account of the current financial year being asked for at any early date, the Government Botanist is requested to be good enough to inform me, as soon as possible, what amounts he will require for expenditure during the undermentioned periods respectively, viz:–
